title: 103_hr4465
content: SECTION 1. CLARIFICATION OF EMPLOYMENT TAX STATUS OF CERTAIN FISHERMEN. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 clarify the employment tax status of fishermen. The size of a boat's operating crew is considered to be fewer than 10 individuals if the average crew size over the previous 4 quarters is less than 10. Cash remuneration for crew members is limited to $100 per trip. Amendments clarify that cash remuneration for crew members is limited to $100 per trip and must be for additional duties. Section 6050A(a) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include cash remuneration described in section 3121(b)(20)(A). Amendments to the Social Security Act specify that boat operating crews with fewer than 10 individuals are eligible for certain cash remuneration not exceeding $100 per trip, contingent on a minimum catch. The amendments to the Social Security Act allow for additional cash remuneration for boat operating crews with fewer than 10 individuals, paid for additional duties such as mate, engineer, or cook. The effective date for these amendments is remuneration paid after December 31, 1994, with a special rule also applying to remuneration paid after December 31, 1984, and before January 1, 1995. SEC. 6050Q. RETURNS RELATING TO CERTAIN PURCHASES OF FISH. SEC. 6050Q requires reporting for cash payments of $1,000 or more for fish purchases in a calendar year. The return must include the name, address, and TIN of each payee. Every person required to make a return under SEC. 6050Q must provide a written statement to each payee by January 31 of the following year. The statement should include the name and address of the person making the return, as well as the total amount of payments made to the payee. Every person required to make a return under SEC. 6050Q must furnish a written statement to each payee by January 31 of the following year. Definitions for "cash" and "fish" are provided in this section. Technical amendments to the code include adding section 6050Q for returns related to certain purchases of fish. The code is amended to include a new subparagraph (Q) for returns related to certain purchases of fish under section 6050Q(c). The code is amended to include a new subparagraph (Q) for returns related to certain purchases of fish under section 6050Q(c), effective for payments made after December 31, 1994.
